body:
I have tried this with and without the double and single quotes and it works every time!

However, when I try it against a test that uses NUnit 2.6.4, I do get that error. Is that your situation? 

The v2 driver is passing filter elements that V2 does not understand. Using them should give an error, but it should be a much clearer one than what you are getting!

rename.from: NUnit Console Runner fails with "Invalid filter element" when using --where "class == XXX"
rename.to: V2 driver is passing invalid filter elements to NUnit V2

body:
I changed the title of the issue to reflect what the problem is.

The driver is translating the filter to NUnit V2 filter elements. It detects the bad filter elements and throws an exception. This is definitely as it should be but the message is only clear if you know how the driver works. It should be an exception type for which we do not display a stack trace and should have an explanatory message like "The class filter cannot be used with NUnit V2 tests"

issue.title: Issues 990 991
issue.body:
I did two in one PR here, since they are both small and critical to RC2. Not something we want to do generally, of course.

This fixes #990 by having the v2 driver identify known V3 filter elements that are not supported by V2 and give a special message for them using NUnitEngineException, which eliminates the stack trace display. I also discovered and fixed a problem with the test filter, which was expecting an older format.

It also fixes #991, by changing the Mono.Options namespace to NUnit.Options.

body: Indeed this was against NUnit 2.6.4. Thanks!

Is running v2 tests with the v3 console supported? How do I specify which tests to run against v2?

When I use --test, I get "Invalid filter element: test".

Running v2 tests with the v3 console is supported. The engine looks at the copy of nunit.framework that each assembly is referencing. It then runs each assembly appropriately.

Some of the filters do not work when running v2 tests. We will need to document that. See the code in #992
OK, #992 will fix my issue. Thanks!

issue.title: Give error message when a regex filter is used with NUnit V2
issue.body:
This is something I just noticed when documenting the change made for #990.

When a regular expression is used, as in
   test =~ MyFixture
the driver was translating it to a V2 SimpleTestFixture, which only compares for equality.

So we now have another error message saying you can't use regular expressions to filter V2 tests.

issue.title: Exception Invalid filter element: test

milestone.title: Closed Without Action
milestone.description: This milestone contains closed issues where no action was taken. This includes questions, issues that could not be reproduced, rejected ideas, invalid issues, etc.

issue.body:
When I run tests using NUnit console 3 beta 5 with the arg --testlist I get the following exception in the case when I my tests referenced to nunit.framework, Version 2.6.4.14350.

-- Create a list of tests

System.ArgumentException: Invalid filter element: test
arameter name: xmlNode

erver stack trace:
  at NUnit.Engine.Drivers.NUnit2FrameworkDriver.FromXml(XmlNode xmlNode)

  at NUnit.Engine.Runners.DirectTestRunner.CountTests(TestFilter filter)
  at System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.StackBuilderSink._PrivateProcessMessage(IntPtr md, Object[] args, Object server, Object[]& outArgs)

xception rethrown at [0]:

  at NUnit.Engine.ITestEngineRunner.CountTestCases(TestFilter filter)
